definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)

sentences.english: Annoyed by vuvuzelas at the World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 世界盃賽場上的嗚嗚祖拉惹人厭？

sentences.english: Don't be annoying, and especially not on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 別惹人厭，特別是故意這樣做。

sentences.english: whether the twitterati are more annoying or just more flighty than everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 也不知道是否社交網絡達人會比較惹人厭或更輕浮。

sentences.english: Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking isn't annoying?
sentences.chinese: 像喬伊，常扳指關節就不惹人厭嗎？

sentences.english: Don’t be obnoxious. But do be amazing.
sentences.chinese: 別惹人厭，但要讓人驚歎。

sentences.english: It is not an unsympathetic biography, but Sir Edward has taken against it.
sentences.chinese: 這本傳記並不惹人厭，可愛德華爵士不喜歡它。

sentences.english: Such rain will never be annoying.
She is obnoxious when she's in a bad mood.
sentences.chinese: 她心情不好的時候很惹人厭。

sentences.english: That's too high,' murmured the provoking thing.
sentences.chinese: “太高啦，”這個惹人厭的東西咕嚕着。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
